snippet: Albert Pujols has no home runs, the Angels’ starters have a 5.02 earned run average and the team’s record is 2-5.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that the Los Angeles Angels are off to a rough 2-5 start to the season, with power-hitting first baseman Albert Pujols absent of home runs; notes that pitching is the team's biggest problem.
lead_paragraph: Albert Pujols has no home runs, the Angels’ starters have a 5.02 earned run average and the team’s record is 2-5.

headline.seo: Despite Arrival of Pujols, Los Angeles Angels Struggle
headline.main: Despite Power Shift, Angels Start Season Adrift
headline.print_headline: That Power Shift in the West Needs the Pitching to Join In
